overview:
Shenzhen Hong Kong Plaza (SHKP) is a visionary urban development located in the Guangdong-Hong Kong–Macao Greater Bay Area, a region rapidly emerging as a global technology hub. As part of Shenzhen and Qianhai—two of China’s most forward-thinking cities—this scheme sets a new benchmark for innovative, people-oriented urban design.

The project aims to create a world-class public space in the heart of Qianhai, serving as a civic hub that embraces inclusivity, accessibility, and adaptability. Central to the design is a pragmatic approach that ensures constructability through in-depth site research and modular construction strategies. This method supports the development of a coherent, human-scaled public realm filled with joy and openness. Architectural nodes are strategically placed to activate the site, foster ceremonial connections, and reinforce a strong sense of place. These flexible nodes serve as gathering points that seamlessly integrate into the rhythm of daily urban life, enriching community interaction.

More than just a public space, SHKP acts as a vital piece of urban infrastructure, weaving together transit networks, active spaces, and parkland into a unified landscape. The gently rising deck, emerging from the bay, creates a new man-made ground that redefines the skyline while offering a powerful spatial experience.

Designed to adapt with time and context, SHKP reflects a forward-thinking approach to city-making. It is more than a development—it’s a landmark, a point of orientation, and a symbol of Qianhai’s global aspirations. Through its distinctive form and people-first philosophy, SHKP is set to become an iconic destination recognised around the world.
